question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Integration: Multi-Asset Vault] [Total Value Sum] When summing values across multiple assets using repeated add() calls, can overflow in intermediate steps cause incorrect total_usd_value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Integration: Migration] [Balance Transfer] When migrating balances using add(v1_balance, v2_balance), can overflow cause migration to fail and lock funds? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Integration: Operation Status] [Value Update Check] When verifying vault value increased after operation using sub(post_value, pre_value), can underflow indicate failed operation but not revert? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Precision Sandwich] Can attacker sandwich user transaction between two operations that cause precision loss in div() operations, stealing value through rounding? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Overflow Timing] Can attacker time operations to cause overflows during high-value periods (high oracle prices, large deposits) to DoS the protocol? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Dust Accumulation] Can attacker exploit precision loss in div() to accumulate dust amounts that eventually sum to significant value? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Math Library Bypass] Can other modules bypass safe_math functions and use raw arithmetic, introducing vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Assertion Gas Limit] Can attacker craft inputs that cause assertions to be evaluated but fail, consuming gas without reverting early enough? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Cross-Module Overflow] When value flows between modules using safe_math in one but raw arithmetic in another, can overflow be introduced at module boundary? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Rounding Direction] Can attacker exploit consistent rounding direction in div() to slowly drain vault value over many operations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Fee Griefing] Can attacker make deposits that result in calculated fees rounding to zero due to div() truncation, avoiding fees repeatedly? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Share Dilution] By exploiting precision loss in share calculation using mul() and div(), can attacker dilute existing shareholders? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Advanced Attack] [Oracle Manipulation] Can attacker submit oracle prices that cause overflow in value calculations using mul(), forcing operations to fail at critical moments? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Type Safety] [u256 Max Value] Are there assumptions that u256::MAX will never be reached that could be violated in extreme market conditions or through deliberate attack? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Type Safety] [Implicit Conversion] Can implicit type conversions between u64, u128, and u256 in calling code introduce overflow that safe_math doesn't catch? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Type Safety] [Negative Numbers] Since Move doesn't have native signed integers, can misuse of safe_math to emulate negative numbers cause logic errors? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Type Safety] [Zero Representation] Are there edge cases where zero could be represented differently (0u256 vs cast from 0u64) causing comparison failures? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Move Semantics] [Assertion Timing] Does Move guarantee assertions execute before arithmetic operations, or can compiler optimization change order? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Move Semantics] [Abort Behavior] When assertion fails, does Move properly roll back all state changes, or can partial state corruption occur? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Move Semantics] [Public Function Safety] Are public functions callable by malicious modules that could provide unexpected inputs? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Move Semantics] [Inline Optimization] Can Move compiler inline these functions in ways that bypass safety checks? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Business Logic] [First Deposit Attack] In vault's first deposit, using div(total_assets, total_shares) when both are zero or very small, can attacker manipulate share price by donating assets before second user deposits? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Business Logic] [Withdrawal Queue Math] When processing withdrawals from request queue, can accumulated precision losses from repeated div() operations cause queue to become insolvent? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Business Logic] [Epoch Rollover] During epoch rollover when calculating new stake ratios using div(), can precision loss cause LST to slowly depeg from SUI? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/safe_math.move] [Business Logic] [Fee Compounding] When fees are reinvested and calculated using mul() and div() repeatedly, can compounding errors accumulate? (Medium)
